clauses-english.clause: The Most Merciful
Taught the Qur'an,
Created man,
[And] taught him eloquence.

4906.verse-english: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,

clauses-english.clause: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,

4907.verse-english: And the stars and trees prostrate.

clauses-english.clause: And the stars and trees prostrate.

4908.verse-english: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance

clauses-english.clause: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance

4909.verse-english: That you not transgress within the balance.

clauses-english.clause: That you not transgress within the balance.

4910.verse-arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ
4910.verse-english: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ

clauses-english.clause: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.

4911.verse-english: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.

clauses-english.clause: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.

4912.verse-english: Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]

clauses-english.clause: Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]

4913.verse-english: And grain having husks and scented plants.

clauses-english.clause: And grain having husks and scented plants.

4914.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4915.verse-english: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

clauses-english.clause: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

4916.verse-arabic: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ
4916.verse-english: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ

clauses-english.clause: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.

4917.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4918.verse-english: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.

clauses-english.clause: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.

4919.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4920.verse-english: He released the two seas, meeting [side by side];

clauses-english.clause: He released the two seas,
meeting [side by side];

4921.verse-english: Between them is a barrier [so] neither of them transgresses.

clauses-english.clause: Between them is a barrier [so] neither of them transgresses.

4922.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4923.verse-english: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.

clauses-english.clause: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.

4924.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4925.verse-arabic: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ
4925.verse-english: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ

clauses-english.clause: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.

4926.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4927.verse-english: Everyone upon the earth will perish,

clauses-english.clause: Everyone upon the earth will perish,

4928.verse-arabic: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
4928.verse-english: And there will remain the Face of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

clauses-english.clause: And there will remain the Face of your Lord,
Owner of Majesty and Honor.

4929.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4930.verse-arabic: يَسْأَلُهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ
4930.verse-english: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is bringing about a matter.

clauses-english.clause: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him;
every day He is bringing about a matter.

4931.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4932.verse-english: We will attend to you, O prominent beings.

clauses-english.clause: We will attend to you,
O prominent beings.

4933.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4934.verse-arabic: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ
4934.verse-english: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allah].

clauses-english.clause: O company of jinn and mankind,
if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth,
then pass.
You will not pass except by authority [from God].

4935.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4936.verse-arabic: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِّن نَّارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
4936.verse-english: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke, and you will not defend yourselves.

clauses-english.clause: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke,
and you will not defend yourselves.

4937.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4938.verse-arabic: فَإِذَا انشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ
4938.verse-english: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil -

clauses-english.clause: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-
colored like oil -

4939.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4940.verse-arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْأَلُ عَن ذَنبِهِ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ
4940.verse-english: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْأَلُ عَن ذَنبِهِ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ

clauses-english.clause: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.

4941.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4942.verse-arabic: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ
4942.verse-english: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

clauses-english.clause: The criminals will be known by their marks,
and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

4943.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4944.verse-arabic: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
4944.verse-english: This is Hell, which the criminals deny.

clauses-english.clause: This is Hell,
which the criminals deny.

4945.verse-english: They will go around between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].

clauses-english.clause: They will go around between it and scalding water,
heated [to the utmost degree].

4946.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4947.verse-english: But for he who has feared the position of his Lord are two gardens -

clauses-english.clause: But for he who has feared the position of his Lord are two gardens -

4948.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
Having [spreading] branches.

4950.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4951.verse-english: In both of them are two springs, flowing.

clauses-english.clause: In both of them are two springs,
flowing.

4952.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4953.verse-english: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.

clauses-english.clause: In both of them are of every fruit,
two kinds.

4954.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4955.verse-arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
4955.verse-english: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.

clauses-english.clause: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade,
and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.

4956.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4957.verse-arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
4957.verse-english: In them are women limiting [their] glances, untouched before them by man or jinni -

clauses-english.clause: In them are women limiting [their] glances,
untouched before them by man or jinni -

4958.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4959.verse-english: As if they were rubies and coral.

clauses-english.clause: As if they were rubies and coral.

4960.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4961.verse-english: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?

clauses-english.clause: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?

4962.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4963.verse-english: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -

clauses-english.clause: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -

4964.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
Dark green [in color].

4966.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4967.verse-english: In both of them are two springs, spouting.

clauses-english.clause: In both of them are two springs,
spouting.

4968.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4969.verse-english: In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.

clauses-english.clause: In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.

4970.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4971.verse-english: In them are good and beautiful women -

clauses-english.clause: In them are good and beautiful women -

4972.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
Fair ones reserved in pavilions -

4974.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4975.verse-arabic: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
4975.verse-english: Untouched before them by man or jinni -

clauses-arabic.clause: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ

clauses-english.clause: Untouched before them by man or jinni -

4976.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4977.verse-arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ
4977.verse-english: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.

clauses-arabic.clause: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ

clauses-english.clause: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.

4978.verse-english: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

clauses-english.clause: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4979.verse-arabic: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
4979.verse-english: Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

clauses-english.clause: Blessed is the name of your Lord,
Owner of Majesty and Honor.
